description:
While YSC3207 focused on programming in different languages and tools to
help software development, students at this point do not really understand
how an Operating System works.

Operating Systems are also actually programs and as such, follow the same
rules and logic on a lower level. Computer Scientists should have enough knowledge to understand these low level mechanisms in order to be able to
develop on any given platform.
title: Programming Operating Systems, Interfaces & eXtras
prerequisite: YSC1212 Introduction to Computer Science or YCC2221 Introduction to Python or with the permission of the instructor.
